Sentencas: The aim of the present study is the measurement and understanding of sulfur poisoning phenomena in nickel/gadolinium-doped ceria (CGO) based solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) operating on reformate fuels.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: The sulfur poisoning behavior of commercial, high-performance electrolyte-supported cells (ESC) with Ni/Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-delta (CGO10) anodes operated with different fuels was thoroughly investigated by means of current-voltage characteristics and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and compared with Ni/Yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) anodes.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: Various methane and carbon monoxide containing fuels were used in order to elucidate the underlying reaction mechanism.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: The analysis of the cell resistance increase in H-2/H2O/CO/CO2 fuel gas mixtures revealed that the poisoning behavior is mainly governed by an inhibited hydrogen oxidation reaction at low current densities.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: At higher current densities, the resistance increase becomes increasingly large, indicating a particularly severe poisoning effect on the carbon monoxide conversion reactions.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: However, the ability of Ni/CGO anodes to convert carbon monoxide even at H2S concentrations up to 20 ppm was demonstrated, while this was not possible for Ni/YSZ.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: The sulfur poisoning behavior of Ni/CGO in reformate fuels was fully reversible for short exposure times.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: From methane steam re-forming experiments, it is deduced that the Ni surface is blocked and, thus, the water-gas shift reaction is fully deactivated as well.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: However, electrochemical CO oxidation on the CGO surface was shown to be still active.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes

Sentencas: The present results clearly demonstrate that the high sulfur tolerance of Ni/CGO not only is limited to H-2/H2O fuel systems but also extends to CO-containing gases.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Electrochemical Reformate Conversion on Nickel/Gadolinium-Doped Ceria Electrodes
